response:

Question: how to convert ANSI to utf8 in java?: :This question already has answers here:                                                            Converting a txt File from ANSI to UTF-8 programmatically                                (2 answers)                            Closed 9 years ago.I have a text file it is ANSI Encoding, i have to convert it into UTF8 encoding. My text file is like thisStochastic programming is an area of mathematical programming that studieshow to model decision problems under uncertainty. For example, although adecision might be necessary at a given point in time, essential informationmight not be available until a later time.
Please using this api: PrintWriter.write.
Answer: <<<api>>>: PrintWriter.write
<<<code>>>: 
```java
try {
    BufferedReader br = new BufferedReader(new InputStreamReader(new FileInputStream("input.txt"), "windows-1252"));
    PrintWriter writer = new PrintWriter("output.txt", "UTF-8");
    String line;
    while ((line = br.readLine()) != null) {
        writer.println(line);
    }
    writer.close();
} catch (IOException e) {
    e.printStackTrace();
}
```
<<<explanation>>>: This code reads the input file using a BufferedReader with the ANSI encoding "windows-1252". It then writes the content to the output file using a PrintWriter with the UTF-8 encoding. The read lines are written directly to the output file, so no additional conversion is necessary.
